title: Science Education Design Through Learning Environment Awareness-Preference Alignment Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience with digital device usage
context.additional_context: Targets students accustomed to smartphone-based learning environments, requiring efficient instructional design due to time constraints inherent in vocational training institutions

learning_goals: Students can recognize the characteristics of science lessons provided in a mobile microlearning environment, compare them with their preferences, and perform a matching analysis with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can propose three specific suggestions for improving learning environment design based on survey results.
Students understand how to statistically analyze differences between perceptions and preferences of learning environments, interpret results, and derive educational design implications.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
